alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 1:16PM MST until July 17 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... Navajo County in north central near Show Low Arizona... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 113 PM MST, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Show Low, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts, quarter size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Public report of quarter size hail. Radar indicated rotation within the storm. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Show Low, Scott Reservoir Campground, Fool Hollow Lake Campground and White Mountain Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room of a building. Strong thunderstorms in the area have the potential to produce tornadoes. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
